title: EU Fixes 2028 Deadline for Russian Energy Exit, Rejecting Trump’s Demands
summary: The European Union announced on Thursday that it will lock in its deadline to phase out Russian oil and gas imports by January 1, 2028, holding firm even as Washington demands an accelerated timetable. According to Reuters, EU Energy Commissioner Dan Jorgensen confirmed the commitment following tal…

title: Oil Tanker Rates Staging A Comeback
summary: Tanker markets staged a comeback in August, and this time the rebound wasn’t subtle. Suezmax rates shot up 34% month-on-month, according to OPEC’s latest Monthly Oil Market Report published on Thursday, with the West Africa–US Gulf Coast run alone surging 38%. VLCCs weren’t far behind, climbing 19%…

title: Saudi Crude Sales to China Set for October Jump amid Deep Price Cut
summary: Saudi Arabia’s crude shipments to China are expected to rebound in October to a level with the August volumes of more than two-year highs, after Saudi state oil giant Aramco slashed the price of its crude for Asia next month. title: Iraq Eyes New Oil Export Route Through Oman
summary: Iraq plans to build an oil pipeline to Oman as OPEC’s second-largest producer seeks to boost exports and diversify export routes for its crude out of the Middle East. Iraq and Oman have reached a preliminary agreement for a pipeline from Iraq to the port of Duqm on the Gulf of Oman, Ali Nizar, dire…

title: Inside Wealth: Family offices double down on stocks and dial back on private equity
summary: A new Goldman Sachs survey found that investment firms of the uber-rich are making opportunistic bets.

title: Saudi Arabia Offers Deeper Crude Discounts to Asian Buyers
summary: Aramco has urged Asian buyers to buy more Saudi crude for October loading after the world’s top crude exporter slashed its prices for Asia for next month, Reuters reported on Thursday, citing sources with knowledge of the matter. title: EU Reluctant to Impose Oil-Related Tariffs on China and India
summary: The European Union is not ready to slap tariffs on India and China for their continued buying of Russian oil, Reuters has reported, citing unnamed officials from Brussels. title: Belgium open to softer stance on frozen Russian assets if EU shares risk
summary: Foreign minister warns bloc not to ‘kill the hen laying golden eggs’
